question.content: Calculate the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides as 4 and 5.

original_tool.name: math.hypot
original_tool.description: Calculate the Euclidean norm, sqrt(sum(squares)), the length of the vector from the origin to point (x, y) which is the hypotenuse of the right triangle.

z.description: Optional. The z-coordinate value. Default is 0.

original_tool.description: Solve a quadratic equation given coefficients a, b, and c. If optional 'root_type' is 'real', the function will only return real roots. If not specified, function may return complex roots.

a.description: The coefficient of the squared term in the quadratic equation.

b.description: The coefficient of the linear term in the quadratic equation.

c.description: The constant term in the quadratic equation.

root_type.description: The type of roots to return: 'real' for real roots, 'all' for both real and complex roots. Default value is 'real'.
